intro: Silene biebersteinii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada pink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to magenta flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from June to August. Silene biebersteinii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and open slopes.
